statement: It is a vaccination certificate that organizers of events should be able to request upon entry.
It is for all parents for at least three days a week that childcare should be free.
It is the European Union (EU) that The Netherlands should exit.
It is a tax per kilometer driven for motorists that there should be instead of the tax on car ownership.
It is decorative fireworks that should be allowed to set off again during the upcoming New Year's Eve.
It is to public broadcasting that less funding should go.
It is a national healthcare fund for everyone that there should be instead of the existing health insurance companies.
It is the ban on face-covering clothing that the government should abolish.
It is where new residential areas are built that the national government, rather than provinces and municipalities, should decide.
It is the VAT on cultural activities that the government should reduce to 5 percent.
It is a new nuclear power plant that the Netherlands should build.
It is land currently used for agriculture that houses should be built on.
It is the same tax benefits that households with two partners, one of whom works, should receive as households with two working partners.
It is the historical slave trade that the Dutch government should apologize for.
It is the opportunity that citizens should have to block laws passed by parliament through a referendum.
It is as much as secondary school teachers that primary school teachers should earn.
It is fewer options for community service sentences instead of prison sentences that there should be
It is an additional flight tax for short-distance flights that the Netherlands should introduce.
It is integration that Asylum seekers with a temporary residence permit should complete before getting a rental home.
It is Dutch-language education that the government should make more frequently mandatory at universities and colleges.
It is assistance with suicide that people who consider their lives complete should be able to receive.
It is an increase in welfare benefits that An increase in minimum wages should no longer automatically result in.
It is at least 40 percent green space that New residential areas should consist of.
It is no new restrictions on the activities of farming businesses that there should be.
It is a choice between vocational education, general secondary education, or pre-university education at a later age that students should make.
It is more refugees than it currently does that the Netherlands should accept.
It is the choice of whether to wear a face mask that People should always have.
It is limiting rights and freedoms that is necessary to combat organized crime.
It is a threat to Spain's security that the growth of Islam is.
It is the efficiency of public services that improves when they are privatized.
It is easier for companies to fire workers that it should be.
It is measures that the state should take to redistribute wealth from the rich to the poor.
It is spending on public health care that the government must increase, even if this means increasing taxes.
It is a permanent tax on large fortunes and assets that is necessary.
It is in the economy that Governments should intervene as little as possible.
It is human action that climate change is solely attributable to.
It is irrigated agricultural areas that the future Spanish government should increase by means of large water transfers.
It is more sovereignty that we must recover to better defend Spain's interests in Europe.
It is the strengthening of NATO in Europe that Spanish government should promote.
It is the State that negotiating with pro-independence supporters weakens.
It is Spain's territorial decentralization that must be deepened.
It is Spanish that the policies of linguistic immersion in the native language of bilingual Autonomous Communities endanger.
It is the Law of Democratic Memory passed during this legislature that it is necessary to repeal.
It is their own health services that immigrants should pay for.
It is on all highways that a general speed limit is to apply.
It is its defense spending that Germany is to increase.

It is the right of recognized refugees to join their families that is to be abolished.
It is revenue generated in Germany from digital services that a national tax is to be levied on.
It is the traditional family of father, mother and children that is to be promoted more strongly than other living arrangements.
It is Donations from companies to political parties that should continue to be permitted.
It is BAf√∂G that students should receive regardless of their parents' income.
It is a second citizenship in addition to the German one that in Germany, it should generally be possible to have.
It is linguistic account of different gender identities that Federal authorities are to take in their publications.

It is the solidarity surcharge that is to be abolished completely.

It is more responsibilities in school policy that the federal government is to be given.
It is more financial support that the federal government is to provide for projects to combat anti-Semitism.

It is church tax for religious communities that the state should continue to collect.
It is the European Union that Germany is to leave.

It is the government-set price for CO2 emissions from heating and driving that is to rise more than planned.

It is Air traffic that is to be taxed more heavily.

It is social transfers that should be increased to reduce the effects of inflation on citizens.
It is private visits to specialists that the state should finance if the waiting time at a public facility exceeds three months.
It is a free nursery place that the state should provide for every child.
It is more freedom to choose the content covered in the curriculum that schools should have.
It is low-rent apartments that the state should build for rent.

It is abortion laws that should be liberalized.
It is the same health premium that all entrepreneurs should pay regardless of income.
It is the result of any nationwide referendum that should be binding regardless of turnout.
It is the migrant relocation solutions adopted by the European Union that Poland should adopt.
It is the independence of the judiciary from parliament and the government that should be strengthened.
It is the share of defense spending in Poland's GDP that should be further increased.

It is no later than 2040 that Poland should move away from coal mining.
It is grain imports from Ukraine that Poland should have blocked.
It is the basis of state social policy that Christian values should be.
It is public media funding from the state budget that should be limited.
It is the powers of the secret services to track the activities of citizens on the Internet that should be limited.

It is Hungarian economic interests that Hungarian foreign policy should be guided solely by.
It is by referendum that Hungary should decide whether to remain part of the EU.

It is stronger state regulation of the work of NGOs supported by foreign organisations that is needed.
It is the European Public Prosecutor's Office that Hungary should join.
It is stricter regulation of interception software (e.g. Pegasus) that is needed (e.g. subject to judicial authorisation).
It is disclosure of the origin of criminals that is needed for more effective law enforcement.
It is the age of compulsory schooling that should be raised back to 18.
It is the OECD average of 5.2 per cent (GDP) that education spending should be increased to at least.
It is Teachers' salaries that should be doubled.

It is only men and women that should be allowed to marry.
It is a closer ratio of men to women that Parties should strive for when drawing up lists.
It is targeted measures that the state should take to promote equal participation of fathers and mothers in child-rearing.
It is the Istanbul Convention that the Hungarian government should ratify, which combats violence against women and domestic violence.
It is favourable gas supply contracts that one effective way to reduce rents is to conclude with Russia.
It is Comprehensive public procurement reform that is needed (e.g. opening up large-scale centralised public procurement to smaller firms).
It is people that public employment helps re-enter the labour market.
It is State regulation of the rental housing market that is not necessary.
It is the current three-month unemployment benefit that should be extended.
It is the use of medical cannabis that should be legalised in Hungary.
It is an independent Ministry of Health that should be established.
It is The President of the Hungarian Republic that should be directly elected.
It is Comprehensive reform of the electoral system (redrawing of district boundaries, abolition of winner-take-all compensation, extension of postal voting) that is needed.
It is a legal framework for primary elections that should be provided.
It is 16 that voting age for elections should be.
It is for all that Internet access should be free.
It is Polluting companies that should be taxed more heavily.
It is a broad social dialogue that The redevelopment of urban green spaces (e.g. the Liget project in Budapest) needs.
It is an independent ministry for the environment that is needed.
It is an animal rights commissioner that should be introduced.
It is a positive process that European integration is all in all
It is out of the Eurozone that Italy should get.
It is a common foreign policy that the European Union should have.
It is a common European army that there should be.
It is health emergencies such as Covid-19 that Restrictions on personal freedom and privacy are acceptable to deal with.
It is Migrant landings that must be stopped, even by extreme means.
It is Children, born in Italy to foreign citizens and who have completed schooling that should be granted Italian citizenship (ius scholae).
It is homosexual, bisexual, transgender (LGBT+) people that more civil rights should be granted to.
It is freedom of choice in end-of-life matters (euthanasia) that citizens should be guaranteed.
It is recreational use of marijuana/cannabis that should be allowed.
It is employees that businesses should be able to fire more easily.
It is only by the state and not by private individuals that health care should be managed.
It is the Italian economy that the introduction of a single income tax rate ("flat tax") would benefit.
It is an hourly minimum wage that should be introduced.
It is beach concessions to private individuals that should be time-limited.
It is the use of nuclear power plants for the purpose of producing energy that should be promoted.
It is a priority for Italy that The construction of Major Works is.
It is more incinerators/thermal power plants that Italy should build.
It is more energy resources that drilling is necessary to find.
It is necessary infrastructure for Italy that Regasifiers are.
It is its foreign policy that Italy should keep aligned with the choices of the Atlantic Alliance (NATO).
It is Sanctions against Russia that should be tougher.
It is arms and war material that Italy should stop sending to the Ukrainian government.
It is in the region itself that Taxes collected at the regional level should be fully retained.
It is separation of careers between judges and prosecutors that should be introduced.
It is Direct election of the President of the Republic that should be introduced.
It is an increase in the retirement age that there should be
It is more funding for health insurance premium subsidies that the federal government should allocate.
It is pensions that are to be reduced (lowering the minimum conversion rate from 6.8% to 6%) as part of the reform of the BVG (occupational pension plan).
It is paid parental leave that should be increased beyond today's 14 weeks of maternity leave and two weeks of paternity leave.
It is more financial support for public housing construction that the federal government should provide.
It is compulsory vaccination of children that should be introduced based on the Swiss vaccination plan.
It is an introduction of a tax on foods containing sugar (sugar tax) that there should be
It is health care costs that insured persons should contribute more to (e.g., increase the minimum deductible).
It is the hospital offering (national hospital planning with regard to locations and range of services) that the federal government should be given the authority to determine.
It is the requirements for the high school that the federal government should raise.
It is equal educational opportunities that the state should be more committed to (e.g., through subsidized remedial courses for students from low-income families).
It is More qualified workers from non-EU/EFTA countries that should be allowed to work in Switzerland (increase third-country quota)
It is the right to vote and stand for election at the municipal level that foreign nationals who have lived in Switzerland for at least ten years should be granted.
It is Cannabis use that should be legalized.
It is direct active euthanasia that doctors should be allowed to administer.
It is a third official gender that should be introduced alongside 'female' and 'male'.
It is the same rights as heterosexual couples that Same-sex couples should have in all areas.
It is tax cuts that there should be at the federal level over the next four years.
It is taxed separately (individual taxation) that married couples be.
It is the introduction of a national inheritance tax on all inheritances over one million Swiss francs that there should be
It is the differences between cantons with high and low financial capacity that should be further reduced through fiscal equalization.
It is a minimum wage of CHF 4,000 for all full-time employees that should be introduced.
It is stricter regulations for the financial sector that there should be.
It is Housing construction regulations that should be relaxed (e.g., noise protection, occupancy rates).
It is busy sections of highways that should be widened.
It is the registration of new passenger cars with internal combustion engines starting in 2035 that Switzerland should ban.
It is incentives and target agreements that to achieve climate targets, should be relied on exclusively, rather than bans and restrictions.
It is environmental and landscape protection rules that are being relaxed to allow for the development of renewable energy.
It is the construction of new nuclear power plants that should be allowed again.
It is a comprehensive public service offering also in rural regions that the state should guarantee
It is Increasing electricity tariffs when consumption is higher (progressive electricity tariffs) that should be introduced.
It is The protection regulations for large predators (lynx, wolf, bear) that should be relaxed.
It is farmers with proof of ecological performance that direct payments should only be granted to.
It is stricter animal welfare regulations for livestock that there should be (e.g. permanent access to outdoor areas).
It is 30% of Switzerland's land area that should be dedicated to preserving biodiversity?
It is the latest technology (currently 5G standard) that the Swiss mobile network should be equipped throughout the country with.
It is additional powers in the area of digitization of government services that the federal government should be given in order to be able to impose binding directives and standards on the cantons.
It is a popular initiative that aims to reduce television and radio fees (CHF 200 per household, exemption for businesses) that there should be.
It is to 16 that the voting age should be lowered.
It is a referendum on federal spending above a certain amount (optional financial referendum) that it should be possible to hold.
It is to at least 120,000 that the army's target number of soldiers should expand.
It is their cooperation with NATO that the Swiss Armed Forces should expand.
It is other states that the Federal Council should be allowed to authorize to re-export Swiss weapons in cases of a war of aggression in violation of international law (e.g., the attack on Ukraine).
It is in public spaces that automatic facial recognition should be banned.
It is closer relations with the European Union (EU) that there should be.
It is their subsidiaries and suppliers operating abroad that Companies should be obliged to ensure that they comply with social and environmental standards.
It is a strict interpretation of neutrality that Switzerland should return to (renounce economic sanctions to a large extent).
